sentences.en: ( The dissenters would have allowed even more leeway to the Secretary. )
sentences.cn: ( 持异议者还会给行政长官留有更多的余地. )

sentences.en: Better to be quiet and leave a little leeway.
sentences.cn: 还是少说几句,留点余地罢.

sentences.en: Don't make inflexible, leave some leeway.
sentences.cn: 留点回旋余地, 别把话说死了.

sentences.en: Give me lots of leeway around the chest.
sentences.cn: 胸围部分多给我留些余地.

sentences.en: He gave the boy a lot of leeway.
sentences.cn: 他给那男孩充分的自由.

sentences.en: He just could not make up the leeway from the earlier stages in which Ryan scored well.
sentences.cn: 瑞安在前几轮得分很高，他现在再想赶也赶不上了。

sentences.en: How much leeway should parents give their children?
sentences.cn: 父母应该给孩子留多少自由的空间？

sentences.en: Prince Vajiralongkorn can expect no such leeway.
sentences.cn: 哇集拉隆功王储则别想有这种权威.

sentences.en: Rarely do schoolteachers have leeway to teach classes the way they want.
sentences.cn: 鲜有学校老师可随心所欲地教书的情况。

sentences.en: The danger is that more leeway may mean more rope.
sentences.cn: 但危险是更多的灵活性意味着更多的诀窍.

sentences.en: The leeway is also very important.
This procedure provides for lots of leeway.
sentences.cn: 这套程序留下了很大的回旋余地.

sentences.en: This well give us more leeway.
sentences.cn: 订这样一条,可以给我们更多的余地.

sentences.en: We have much leeway to fetch up.
sentences.cn: 我们有很大的差距要赶上.

phrases.tran_cn: (英)（尤指以挽回失去时间的方法）摆脱困境

trans.tran_cn: （航行由于强风所致的）偏航，余地，时间损失，落后，风压差，风压角
trans.tran_en: Leeway is the freedom that someone has to take the action they want to or to change their plans
